ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Wind Solar Wind Experiment (SWE) Strahl Detector Two Dimensional Electron Angular Distributions, (H4), 12 s Data

RevisionEvent.Note: Updated to SPASE Version 2.3.2 if needed, Applied quality control for DOI usage, LFB

ResourceHeader.Description: Explanatory Notes: The 2D Electron Angular Distributions included in this Data Set were measured by the Wind/SWE Strahl Detector (see Ogilvie et al., "SWE, a Comprehensive Plasma Instrument for the Wind Spacecraft", Space Sci. Rev., 71, 55, 1995). Each Angular Distribution was measured at a single Electron Energy. The Energy was selected by applying a Voltage between the Electrostatic Analyzer Plates. The Detector sampled 32 Energies between 19 eV and 1238 eV, and during normal Operation would Sweep through these Energies one at a Time with approximately 12 s Cadence. The 12 Anodes of the Instrument are set in a vertical Pattern in a Plane that contains the Spacecraft Spin Axis, spanning a Field of View +/-28° centered around the Ecliptic (with uneven Angular spacing between Anodes). The Wind Spacecraft Spin Axis is set at a Right Angle with the Ecliptic Plane, allowing different Azimuthal Angles to be sampled as the Spacecraft Spins (3 s Spin Period). These Azimuthal Bins have a Fixed Separation of 3.53°. Each Strahl (and Antistrahl) Distribution measured by the Spacecraft consists of a 14 ⨯ 12 Angular Grid of Electron Counts, that was measured at a Fixed Energy during a single Spacecraft Spin. Counts are converted into Physical Units of f(v) (e.g., cm^-6s^3) in the standard Fashion by accounting for the Detector Efficiency and Geometric Factor. The Data Set reported here contains: f_strahl, f_antistrahl, f_strahl_counts, f_antistrahl_counts, phi_strahl, phi_antistrahl, theta, energy.

PublicationInfo.Authors: Ogilvie, Keith W.; Horaites, Konstantinos; Merka, Jan; Vinas, Adolfo F.; & Fitzenreiter, Richard J.

Parameter.Name: Epoch Time
Parameter.Description: Epoch Time, Nominal Time of the Strahl Measurement, Milliseconds since 1 AD
Parameter.Caveats: Measurements of the Strahl and Antistrahl are taken within a single 3 s Spin Period This parameter exhibits an increasing monotonic progression.

Parameter.Name: f Strahl Intensities versus Phi and Theta, Log Scale
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: f Strahl Intensities versus Phi and Theta Angles in Sweep Energy Order, Logarithmic Scale, Animated GIFs
Parameter.Caveats: 2D Angular Electron Distribution in Physical Units of #/(cm^3*(cm/s)^3). Measured at Fixed Energy in a Fraction of a single Spacecraft Spin. f_strahl corresponds with the Anti-sunward, Field-aligned Portion of the Distribution Function, which likely exhibits a pronounced Strahl Signature.

Parameter.Name: f Strahl Intensities versus Phi and Theta, Linear Scale
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: f Strahl Intensities versus Phi and Theta Angles in Sweep Energy Order, Linear Scale, Animated GIFs
Parameter.Caveats: 2D Angular Electron Distribution in Physical Units of #/(cm^3*(cm/s)^3). Measured at Fixed Energy in a Fraction of a single Spacecraft Spin. f_strahl corresponds with the Anti-sunward, Field-aligned Portion of the Distribution Function, which likely exhibits a pronounced Strahl Signature. This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function ALTERNATE_VIEW with the following input parameters: f_strahl.

Parameter.Name: f Antistrahl Intensities versus Phi and Theta, Log Scale
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: f Antistrahl Intensities versus Phi and Theta Angles in Sweep Energy Order, Logarithmic Scale, Animated GIFs
Parameter.Caveats: 2D Angular Electron Distribution in Physical Units of #/(cm^3*(cm/s)^3). Measured at Fixed Energy in a Fraction of a single Spacecraft Spin. f_antistrahl corresponds with the Sunward, Field-aligned Portion of the Distribution Function, which sometimes exhibits a pronounced Antistrahl Signature.

Parameter.Name: f Antistrahl Intensities versus Phi and Theta, Linear Scale
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: f Antistrahl Intensities versus Phi and Theta Angles in Sweep Energy Order, Linear Scale, Animated GIFs
Parameter.Caveats: 2D Angular Electron Distribution in Physical Units of #/(cm^3*(cm/s)^3). Measured at Fixed Energy in a Fraction of a single Spacecraft Spin. f_antistrahl corresponds with the Sunward, Field-aligned Portion of the Distribution Function, which sometimes exhibits a pronounced Antistrahl Signature. This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function ALTERNATE_VIEW with the following input parameters: f_antistrahl.

Parameter.Name: f Strahl Count versus Phi and Theta, Log Scale
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: f Strahl Counts versus Phi and Theta Angles in Sweep Energy Order, Logarithmic Scale, Animated GIFs
Parameter.Caveats: 2D Angular Electron Distribution (Detector Counts). Measured at Fixed Energy in a Fraction of a single Spacecraft Spin. f_strahl corresponds with the Anti-sunward, Field-aligned Portion of the Distribution Function, which likely exhibits a pronounced Strahl Signature.

Parameter.Name: f Strahl Count versus Phi and Theta, Linear Scale
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: f Strahl Counts versus Phi and Theta Angles in Sweep Energy Order, Linear Scale, Animated GIFs
Parameter.Caveats: 2D Angular Electron Distribution (Detector Counts). Measured at Fixed Energy in a Fraction of a single Spacecraft Spin. f_strahl corresponds with the Anti-sunward, Field-aligned Portion of the Distribution Function, which likely exhibits a pronounced Strahl Signature. This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function ALTERNATE_VIEW with the following input parameters: f_strahl_counts.

Parameter.Name: f Antistrahl Count versus Phi and Theta, Log Scale
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: f Antistrahl Counts versus Phi and Theta Angles in Sweep Energy Order, Logarithmic Scale, Animated GIFs
Parameter.Caveats: 2D Angular Electron Distribution (Detector Counts). Measured at fixed Energy in a Fraction of a single Spacecraft Spin. f_antistrahl corresponds with the Sunward, Field-aligned Portion of the Distribution Function, which sometimes exhibits a pronounced Antistrahl Signature.

Parameter.Name: f Antistrahl Count versus Phi and Theta, Linear Scale
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: f Antistrahl Counts versus Phi and Theta Angles in Sweep Energy Order, Linear Scale, Animated GIFs
Parameter.Caveats: 2D Angular Electron Distribution (Detector Counts). Measured at fixed Energy in a Fraction of a single Spacecraft Spin. f_antistrahl corresponds with the Sunward, Field-aligned Portion of the Distribution Function, which sometimes exhibits a pronounced Antistrahl Signature. This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function ALTERNATE_VIEW with the following input parameters: f_antistrahl_counts.

Parameter.Name: Electron Velocity Direction, Phi Angle, Strahl
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: The Phi (GSE) associated with the Unit Vector pointing in Electron Velocity Direction for the Strahl Distribution
Parameter.Caveats: phi_strahl corresponds with Azimuthal Directions (phi GSE) sampled during the Measurement of f_strahl

Parameter.Name: Electron Velocity Direction, Phi Angle, Antistrahl
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: The Phi (GSE) associated with the Unit Vector pointing in Electron Velocity Direction for the Antistrahl Distribution
Parameter.Caveats: phi_antistrahl corresponds with Azimuthal Directions (phi GSE) sampled during the Measurement of f_antistrahl

Parameter.Name: Electron Velocity Direction, Theta Angle
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: The Theta (GSE) associated with unit vector pointing in electron velocity direction
Parameter.Caveats: The 12 Anodes of the SWE Strahl Detector are arranged in a fixed Pattern, with non-uniform Spacing

Parameter.Name: Electron Energy
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Energy of the Sampled Electrons used to construct the f Strahl and f_antistrahl distributions
Parameter.Caveats: The Strahl Detector swept through 32 different Energies, one at a Time, with about 12 s between each Energy Step
